item.title: Section 2= The motions of bodies that are resisted in the duplicate ratio of the velocities
item.description: Proposition 5 Theorem 3 If a body is resisted in the duplicate ratio of its velocity, and moves by innate force only through a similar medium; and the times be taken in a geometrical progression, proceeding from less to greater terms = that the velocities at the beginning of each of the times are in the same geometrical progression inversely ; and that the spaces are equal, which are described in each of the times.
